posts.post_content:
How exactly is this white? A "greedy", "vain" dragon that requires a sacrifice to be used offensively. Sounds black or red to me. Heck, I'd put it in green over white, the flying would at least be welcome there.  
And don't blame this guy's current level of suckage on power creep, he was predated by the (nonstrictly) superior [Pearl Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pearl Dragon).

Posted By: pigknight (11/1/2011 8:14:40 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I stumbled across this card while searching for 6 cost Dragons that would work well in a Commander deck. This horrible card wouldn't work in any deck! It seems like some ghastly tribute to Elder Land Wurm, an equally useless 5/5 white "dragon" that couldn't attack until some absurd condition was met. Elder Land Wurm, while horrible, at least had the excuse that it was printed when Magic was very young and was in a set surrounded by other terrible creatures. There's no excuse for this pile of drek. Even by this point, a 5/5 flyer for 4WW would have been considered "decent" - slapping a killer drawback on it makes it useless. Had it been a 6/6, it still would have been useless, but at least it could be sort of justified. Worst. Dragon. Ever.
posts.html:

Posted By: pigknight (11/1/2011 8:14:40 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
You guys don't get it, do you?
  
   
Angels might, sometimes, when they're ordered to by God anyway, care about humans. Maybe.
  
Dragons? Demons? Behemoths? Hydras? Since when was it THEIR job to ensure YOUR victory?
  
   
oh, I see-- you're a *planeswalker*. You're *special*.
  
   
Dragons don't care two cents about that. Summoning giant creatures is impressive because most of them don't like being summoned!   
   
Welcome to Advanced Dungeons and Dragons: 101! (This isn't the Girl Scouts- you should leave your deckboxes at home and try grabbing some REAL weapons. Preferably ones not made of cardboard.)
  
Forget everything else you ever thought you knew about dragons, and repeat after me:
  
"I am a weak, tasty human."
  
"Dragons eat nerds like me. All the time."
  
"I should be THANKING Wizards that this is ONLY a Dungeons and Dragons creature, NOT a Dungeons and Dragons land" (like Tomb of Horrors. \*shudder\*)
  
   
It could have been worse, people. It could have been much, much worse.... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
You guys don't get it, do you?

Angels might, sometimes, when they're ordered to by God anyway, care about humans. Maybe.
Dragons? Demons? Behemoths? Hydras? Since when was it THEIR job to ensure YOUR victory?

oh, I see-- you're a planeswalker. You're special.

Dragons don't care two cents about that. Summoning giant creatures is impressive because most of them don't like being summoned!

Welcome to Advanced Dungeons and Dragons: 101! (This isn't the Girl Scouts- you should leave your deckboxes at home and try grabbing some REAL weapons. Preferably ones not made of cardboard.)
Forget everything else you ever thought you knew about dragons, and repeat after me:
"I am a weak, tasty human."
"Dragons eat nerds like me. All the time."
"I should be THANKING Wizards that this is ONLY a Dungeons and Dragons creature, NOT a Dungeons and Dragons land" (like Tomb of Horrors. *shudder*)

It could have been worse, people. It could have been much, much worse.... (see all)

Tagging sh\*t is fun.
